org.csstudio.platform.simpledal
Interface IProcessVariableConnectionService

All Known Implementing Classes:
ProcessVariableConnectionService
public interface IProcessVariableConnectionService

A service which can be used for easy access to control system channels. A control system channel is addressed via a IProcessVariableAddress. Please use ProcessVariableAdressFactory to create these addresses. The service is designed to save system resources and share physical channels whenever possible. The same physical connection (in case of EPICs, TINE, TANGO) is reused in the following cases:

  • for all connections to the same process variable with the same value type
  • for all connections to characteristics of the same process variable
    • You may use the ProcessVariableConnectionServiceFactory to create instances of this service.

    Author:
    Sven Wende, Matthias Zeimer

    readValueAsynchronously

    void readValueAsynchronously(IProcessVariableAddress processVariableAddress,
                             ValueType valueType,
                             IProcessVariableValueListener listener)
    Asynchronously reads a value from the channel addressed by the the given process variable address. When the value was received, the IProcessVariableValueListener#valueChanged(Object) method will be called on the given listener.

    Parameters:
    processVariableAddress - the process variable address
    valueType - the expected value type
    listener - the call-back listener

    Parameters:

    Returns:
    the current value
    Throws:
    ConnectionException

    register

    void register(IProcessVariableValueListener listener,
              IProcessVariableAddress pv,
              ValueType valueType)
    Starts listening permanently on the channel addressed by the specified process variable address. The corresponding channel will be open as long as any permanent listener is alive. For convenience this service references the specified listener only weakly which means that it will be garbage collected when its no longer referenced outside this service. If you want to stop listening explicitly please use the unregister(IProcessVariableValueListener) method. To stop listening just Use the unregister(IProcessVariableValueListener)

    Parameters:
    listener - the listener that will receive the value change notifications
    pv - the process variable address
    valueType - the expected value type

    unregister

    void unregister(IProcessVariableValueListener listener)
    Stops the specified permanent listener.

    Parameters:
    listener - the listener

    Checks whether the current user is allowed to write values to the specified channel.

    Parameters:

    Returns:
    one of SettableState.values()
